recipe.ingredients: - large mushrooms: 20 (stems removed) - olive oil: 2 tablespoons - garlic (minced): 3 cloves - fresh parsley (chopped): 1/4 cup - fresh thyme (chopped): 1 tablespoon - fresh basil (chopped): 1 tablespoon - breadcrumbs: 1/2 cup - grated Parmesan cheese: 1/4 cup - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Preheat Oven: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). 2. Prepare Mushrooms: Wash and dry the mushrooms. Remove the stems and chop them finely. Set the caps aside. 3. Sauté Ingredients: In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and chopped mushroom stems. Sauté until tender. 4. Mix Filling: In a bowl, combine the sautéed mushroom stems and garlic with chopped parsley, thyme, basil, breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper. 5. Stuff Mushrooms: Fill each mushroom cap with the herb-breadcrumb mixture, packing it lightly. 6. Bake: Place stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet and bake for about 20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender. 7. Serve: Serve warm as an appetizer or a side dish.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 10g, Dietary Fiber: 2g, Sodium: 108mg, Saturated Fat: 1g, Total Fat: 7g, Protein: 4g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 2g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 610 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Large Mushrooms: 100 calories for 20 mushrooms Olive Oil: 239 calories for 2 tablespoons Garlic: Negligible Fresh Parsley, Thyme, Basil: Negligible Breadcrumbs: 200 calories for 1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese: 50 calories for 1/4 cup Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 5 (4 mushrooms each)
